origin.origPlace: Found: Skiathis (Western desert, Egypt); written: Syria

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

keywords.term: Church Fathers, including Addaeus, Alexander of Alexandria, Alexander of Mabug, Amphilochius of Iconium, Anatolius of Constantinople, Andreas of Samosata, Anthinus of Constantinople, Antiochus of Ptolemais, Athanasius, Basilius, Clemens of Rome, Crates philosophus, Cyrillus of Alexandria, Cyrillus of Jerusalem, Damianus of Alexandria, Dionysius Areopagites, Dioscorus of Alexandria, Dorotheus of Marcianopolis, Epiphanius, Ephraim Syrus, Erechtheus of Antiochia, Euagrius Ponticus, Eustathius of Antiochia, Eutyches, Felix of Rome, Gregorius of Nazianze, Gregorius of Nyssa, Gregorius Thaumaturgus, Ibias of Edessa, Ignatius, Irenaeus, Isaac of Antiochia, Isaias of Sketis, Johannes Chrysostumus, Johannes of Jerusalem, Julianus of Halicarnassus, ulius of Rome, Justinianus, Leo of Rome, Maximus of Antiochia, Melito, Methodius, Nestorius, Olympiodorus philosophus, Palladius of Helenopolis, Petrus of Alexandria, Petrus of Antiochia, Philoxenus of Mabug, Proculus of Constantinople, Rabulas of Edessa, Sergius of Antiochia, Severianus of Gabala, Severus of Antiochia, Theodoretus, Theodosius of Alexandria, Theodotus of Ancyra, Theophilus of Alexandria; Timotheus III of Alexandria; Xystus of Rome; dogmatic anthology : "Demonstrations of Church Fathers against different heresies", including some council acts and citations from Philalethes of Severus of Antiochia

bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in The British Museum acquired since the year 1838. 2.

listBibl.bibl: Journal of Early Christian Studies 18 (2010), p. 296
